metadata.synopsis: Dialog with an NPC (Duke Ravengard in this case) in the Audience Hall. Possible states:Before CeremonyCeremonyAfter Ceremony
metadata.how_to_trigger: Before Ceremony: - Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 3 - WYR - Audience Hall- approach Gortash- a dialog will be started. Finish it.- Gortash will go to a private place. Click on the NPC.Ceremony:- same as the above, but talk to Gortash at the private place- cast invisibility on yourself- click on the NPCAfter Ceremony:- same as in "Before Ceremony"- click on Gortash- Finish the dialog with Gortash at the private place- Wait for him to return to his default position and approach him- Wait for the Ceremony dialog to end- Click on the NPC.Ceremony -sneak/invisibility and approach the group

1.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
1.text: Be in awe, Truest Soul. The new dawn will rise.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *Your father, once the Grand Duke, now a pawn in the Absolute's game. Your infected minds smoulder in each others' presence.*

44.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
44.text: My dearest boy. The Hells have touched you. But you've come to me - just as Gortash said you would.

28.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
28.text: Father and son, unstoppable generals. Together, we will usher in a new dawn.

59.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
59.text: My dearest boy, my blood and my pride. You've come to me - just as Gortash said you would.

58.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
58.text: A fresh mind, still untouched. You have not yet heard the Absolute's voice.

35.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
35.text: So much to teach, and so much to learn.

75.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
75.text: Truest of Souls. Bathed in Her light.

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *There is a fleeting connection. Your parasite communes with his, then falls quiet.*
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight mind meld just through the course of the node.

8.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
8.text: My dearest boy. The Hells have touched you. But you've come to me - just as Gortash said you would. A True Soul no less.

29.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
29.text: Father and son, unstoppable generals. You and your allies will usher in a new dawn.

11.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
11.text: Have you come to behold the new dawn?

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I'm here to help you. Florrick sent me.

38.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
38.text: Help me? Ah - the black widow caught you in her web.

0.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
0.text: Florrick chose shadow over light. Her betrayal burned deeper than the fires of Avernus.

68.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
68.text: She's been punished for her lies. Don't let her get to you.

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *The Duke wants to keep Florrick's location a secret. Little does he know that you've already found and freed her.*

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *The Duke wants to keep Florrick's location a secret. Little does he know that you've already found her.*

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: Punished? Then Florrick's been captured. Or worse.
45.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

93.speaker: Shadowheart
93.text: Punished? Florrick must be locked up somewhere - assuming she's still alive.
93.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: When he says 'punished' do you think he means 'locked up' or 'brutally murdered'?
113.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

102.speaker: Gale
102.text: Why do I get the feeling the punishment will be far, far worse than the crime?
102.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Punished?! Gods. Don't want to imagine what that entails. Maybe there's still time to find her.
33.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

116.speaker: Halsin
116.text: Punished? Then Florrick has been captured... or perhaps is no more.
116.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

3.speaker: Jaheira
3.context: NodeContext: Spoken as an aside to player - soft but sharp, suddenly tense. You want to know what became of an ally.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Connect with Ravengard's parasite to seek information about Florrick.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Within Ravengard's memories, you find Counsellor Florrick. She is confined in a cell, right here in Wyrm's Rock.*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *You are unable to penetrate Ravengard's mind.*

18.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
18.text: The sun rises, True Soul. Are you ready?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: What have you done to Florrick?

10.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
10.text: I've stilled her tongue. That's the end of the matter.

115.speaker: Minsc
115.text: 'Punished'...? That is meaning more than a spanking, in a place such as this.
115.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
5.text: How do Baldurans punish traitors? Hanging? Dismemberment? I hope we get to see.
5.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: Punished? Gods - what has he done?
83.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: The Absolute's time has come. She will bring glory to the city.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Indeed. The Absolute will bring glory upon this fair city.

67.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
67.text: Faerûn suffers in darkness. Tyr has abandoned us; Helm's eye has strayed.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *Tyr's fury glows within you. Despite Ravengard's words, the Lord of Justice has remained loyal to you, as you have to him.*

56.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
56.text: But Baldur's Gate will soon burn bright. A beacon to light the heavens.

72.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
72.text: Gortash and I will ignite the final spark. And that, True Soul, is the greatest of goods.

51.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
51.text: And it will be Gortash who ignites the final spark.

84.speaker: Wyll
84.text: No - this isn't him. This is the tadpole talking.
84.context: NodeContext: Upset at seeing his father being controlled by the Absolute

36.speaker: Player
36.text: 'New dawn'? Is that what you call the tyranny the Absolute brings to Baldur's Gate?

95.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
95.text: Why do you say this? Only the shadows would name the sun a tyrant.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Gortash is a tyrant. This 'new dawn' is a lie.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: By the gods, what have they made of the city's great hero?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: My father, my hero. I'll save you from the Absolute's thrall.

85.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
85.text: What is a hero, if not an actor for the greater good?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Don't you understand? You are infected with an illithid parasite.

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *For a brief moment, uncertainty clouds his mind, then dissipates. The Astral Prism vibrates in concord.*
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard touches his head for a brief moment. He is taken aback for a moment.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *Behind Ravengard's eyes, something stirs. A spark of life, of self.*

123.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
123.context: NodeContext: The real Ravengard breaks through his brainwashing, just for a moment.

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *Ravengard's eyes grow empty again. Once again, he speaks coolly and calmly.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Your tadpole seizes, the Prism stills. Ravengard's empty eyes meet yours.*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard shakes his head, regaining control.

2.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
2.text: As I said. Baldur's Gate will ascend. Toril's first and only Grand City.

109.speaker: Wyll
109.text: Father, please. Come back to me.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Call on your tadpole. Explore Ravengard's uncertainty.

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *First comes a vision of terror. The city of Baldur's Gate taken by illithids.*

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *But beyond terror, there is hope. You see a beaming Ravengard presiding over the sunlit city, applauded by the people - a people at peace.*

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: The real Ravengard's still in there - and he wants out.
78.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

105.speaker: Shadowheart
105.text: The true Ravengard is still clinging on, somewhere in that mind. It might not be too late for him.
105.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: So, the real man is still in there somewhere.
107.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: Ravengard hasn't given up yet. His true self is still in there, and could yet be saved.
106.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Ravengard - the real Ravengard - is in there somewhere. We can't give up on him.
55.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

119.speaker: Halsin
119.text: The true Ravengard remains in there somewhere. Perhaps he can yet be restored.
119.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

12.speaker: Jaheira
12.text: The illithids have not erased him entire. Perhaps there is hope yet.
12.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

114.speaker: Minsc
114.text: The true Ravengard still lives within. If Minsc could be freed from his fleshy prison, then so can the Duke!
114.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
20.text: Ravengard is still alive, trapped in his own mind. Just as I was.
20.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player., with sympathy for Ravengard. She wouldn't wish this on her worst enemy

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *The true Ravengard lurks somewhere in this infected mind, seeking freedom - seeking victory.*
111.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *The Prism quivers once more. Ravengard falters.*
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard shakes his head, trying to rid it of his inner turmoil.

49.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
49.text: My dearest boy, my blood and my pride. You've come to me - just as Gortash said you would. A True Soul no less.

97.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
97.text: Her sun will rise. Our future is decided.

103.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
103.text: Be in awe, Truest Soul. The new dawn will rise.

117.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
117.text: Our time has come, son. Together, we will usher in a new dawn.
